intro: Antennaria nitens, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or white and are arranged in small clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Antennaria nitens thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
